title: Torque and work - compare work same time interval

content.question: In Trial <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, a net torque with constant magnitude <math alttext="tau sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is exerted on a disk over a time <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>, bringing it from rest to an angular velocity <math alttext="omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. In Trial <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, a torque with constant magnitude <math alttext="2 tau sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is exerted on the same disk, which is again initially at rest, for the same amount of time, <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="W sub 2 to W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> are the work done in Trial <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and Trial <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, respectively?
